ArtifactDetails.description: Returns information about the details of an artifact.

properties.name: MaximumCount
properties.description: The maximum number of artifacts allowed for the action type.

type.description: The maximum number of artifacts allowed for the action type.

properties.name: MinimumCount
properties.description: The minimum number of artifacts allowed for the action type.

type.description: The minimum number of artifacts allowed for the action type.

ConfigurationProperties.description: The configuration properties for the custom action.

properties.name: Description
properties.description: The description of the action configuration property that is displayed to users.

type.description: The description of the action configuration property that is displayed to users.

properties.name: Key
properties.description: Whether the configuration property is a key.

type.description: Whether the configuration property is a key.

properties.name: Name
properties.description: The name of the action configuration property.

type.description: The name of the action configuration property.

properties.name: Queryable
properties.description: Indicates that the property is used with PollForJobs. When creating a custom action, an action can have up to one queryable property. If it has one, that property must be both required and not secret.If you create a pipeline with a custom action type, and that custom action contains a queryable property, the value for that configuration property is subject to other restrictions. The value must be less than or equal to twenty (20) characters. The value can contain only alphanumeric characters, underscores, and hyphens.

type.description: Indicates that the property is used with PollForJobs. When creating a custom action, an action can have up to one queryable property. If it has one, that property must be both required and not secret.If you create a pipeline with a custom action type, and that custom action contains a queryable property, the value for that configuration property is subject to other restrictions. The value must be less than or equal to twenty (20) characters. The value can contain only alphanumeric characters, underscores, and hyphens.

properties.name: Required
properties.description: Whether the configuration property is a required value.

type.description: Whether the configuration property is a required value.

properties.name: Secret
properties.description: Whether the configuration property is secret. Secrets are hidden from all calls except for GetJobDetails, GetThirdPartyJobDetails, PollForJobs, and PollForThirdPartyJobs.

type.description: Whether the configuration property is secret. Secrets are hidden from all calls except for GetJobDetails, GetThirdPartyJobDetails, PollForJobs, and PollForThirdPartyJobs.

properties.name: Type
properties.description: The type of the configuration property.

type.description: The type of the configuration property.

Settings.description: Settings is a property of the AWS::CodePipeline::CustomActionType resource that provides URLs that users can access to view information about the CodePipeline custom action.

properties.name: EntityUrlTemplate
properties.description: The URL returned to the AWS CodePipeline console that provides a deep link to the resources of the external system, such as the configuration page for an AWS CodeDeploy deployment group. This link is provided as part of the action display in the pipeline.

type.description: The URL returned to the AWS CodePipeline console that provides a deep link to the resources of the external system, such as the configuration page for an AWS CodeDeploy deployment group. This link is provided as part of the action display in the pipeline.

properties.name: ExecutionUrlTemplate
properties.description: The URL returned to the AWS CodePipeline console that contains a link to the top-level landing page for the external system, such as the console page for AWS CodeDeploy. This link is shown on the pipeline view page in the AWS CodePipeline console and provides a link to the execution entity of the external action.

type.description: The URL returned to the AWS CodePipeline console that contains a link to the top-level landing page for the external system, such as the console page for AWS CodeDeploy. This link is shown on the pipeline view page in the AWS CodePipeline console and provides a link to the execution entity of the external action.

properties.name: RevisionUrlTemplate
properties.description: The URL returned to the AWS CodePipeline console that contains a link to the page where customers can update or change the configuration of the external action.

type.description: The URL returned to the AWS CodePipeline console that contains a link to the page where customers can update or change the configuration of the external action.

properties.name: ThirdPartyConfigurationUrl
properties.description: The URL of a sign-up page where users can sign up for an external service and perform initial configuration of the action provided by that service.

type.description: The URL of a sign-up page where users can sign up for an external service and perform initial configuration of the action provided by that service.

resource.description: The AWS::CodePipeline::CustomActionType resource creates a custom action for activities that aren't included in the CodePipeline default actions, such as running an internally developed build process or a test suite. You can use these custom actions in the stage of a pipeline.

properties.name: Category
properties.description: The category of the custom action, such as a build action or a test action.

type.description: The category of the custom action, such as a build action or a test action.

properties.name: ConfigurationProperties
properties.description: The configuration properties for the custom action.

type.description: The configuration properties for the custom action.

properties.name: InputArtifactDetails
properties.description: The details of the input artifact for the action, such as its commit ID.

type.description: The details of the input artifact for the action, such as its commit ID.

properties.name: OutputArtifactDetails
properties.description: The details of the output artifact of the action, such as its commit ID.

type.description: The details of the output artifact of the action, such as its commit ID.

properties.name: Provider
properties.description: The provider of the service used in the custom action, such as AWS CodeDeploy.

type.description: The provider of the service used in the custom action, such as AWS CodeDeploy.

properties.name: Settings
properties.description: URLs that provide users information about this custom action.

type.description: URLs that provide users information about this custom action.

properties.name: Tags
properties.description: Any tags assigned to the custom action.

type.description: Any tags assigned to the custom action.

properties.name: Version
properties.description: The version identifier of the custom action.

type.description: The version identifier of the custom action.

attributes.description: The AWS::CodePipeline::CustomActionType resource creates a custom action for activities that aren't included in the CodePipeline default actions, such as running an internally developed build process or a test suite. You can use these custom actions in the stage of a pipeline.
